subject: The CNN Political Ticker PM, Wednesday, May 02, 2007
body:
CNN.com - CNN Political Ticker










For the latest, breaking political news, check for updates
throughout the day on the CNN Political Ticker
http://www.cnn.com/ticker All politics, all the
time.

Today on the Ticker

President Bush's veto stands, but rhetoric still
flies

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- The House of
Representatives on Wednesday failed to override President
Bush's veto of a $124 billion war spending bill that included a
deadline for U.S. troops to pull out of Iraq.

The
222-203 vote was far short of the two-thirds majority needed to
override the veto.
Bush expressed optimism about a possible
deal with Democrats on the war funding bill, but neither side
seemed closer to compromise.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/2007/POLITICS/05/02/congress.iraq/index.html

***

Bush ready to find
'common ground'

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Meeting
with congressional leaders in the White House Wednesday,
President Bush said he is ready to "find common ground" with
the Democrats on a new Iraq spending bill.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/bush-ready-to-find-common-ground.html

***

Pelosi: Bush administration needs to 'get a
clue'

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- House Speaker Nancy
Pelosi said Wednesday the Bush administration needs to 'get a
clue' when it comes to Iraq.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/pelosi-bush-administration-needs-to-get.html

***

Senator subpoenas Rove's e-mails in prosecutor
firings probe

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Senate
Judiciary Committee Chairman Patrick Leahy, D-Vermont, issued a
subpoena Wednesday to Attorney General Alberto Gonzales in an
effort to obtain e-mails by President Bush's top political
adviser in connection with last year's firings of eight U.S.
attorneys.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/senator-subpoenas-roves-e-mails-in.html

***

Justice investigation examining Goodling role in
hiring career prosecutors

WASHINGTON (CNN) --
The role of former Justice Department liaison to the White
House Monica Goodling is being probed by internal investigators
to see whether she illegally used political affiliation as a
factor in making hiring decisions for some entry-level federal
prosecutor positions.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/justice-investigation-examining.html

***

Obama takes control of MySpace page from jilted
supporter

WASHINGTON (AP) -- Is MySpace
always mine or can it belong to someone else?

At the
cost of losing 160,000 friends, Democrat Barack Obama's
presidential campaign has taken over control of the MySpace
page listed under his name on the popular social networking
site.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/obama-takes-control-of-myspace-page.html

***

Edwards slams Bush veto in new TV ad

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Former North Carolina Sen. John
Edwards is using his first campaign television ad of the 2008
presidential race to slam President Bush's veto of the Iraq war
spending bill and urge members of Congress -- several of which
are his rivals for the Democratic nomination -- to stand firm
on a mandatory deadline for withdrawal.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/edwards-slams-bush-veto-in-new-tv-ad.html

***

'08 hopefuls pick their favorite reality TV
shows

WASHINGTON (AP) -- The presidential
campaign is its own reality series, with elimination rounds of
sorts and a huge prize at the end. The contestants are too busy
with their own "amazing race" to spend much time watching
reality shows on TV.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/08-hopefuls-pick-their-favorite-reality.html

***

Oprah praises Obama, rules out bid of her
own

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Popular talk-show
host Oprah Winfrey reiterated her support of Sen. Barack
Obama's, D-Illinois, presidential bid Tuesday, and told CNN's
Larry King she will never seek political office herself.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/oprah-praises-obama-rules-out-bid-of.html
